title: A modern sans-serif display face with a somewhat retro-future feel
content:
Can anybody help ID this modern sans-serif display face with a somewhat retro-future feel?

Note the detached gaps in the E and R.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [font sample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130508055912/http:/typophile.com/files/font%20sample_2.jpg) | 28.58 KB |
author: daveward

comments.content: Have you looked through the Techno categories at [http://www.dafont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130508055912/http:/www.dafont.com/ "http://www.dafont.com")? Try Sci-Fi and Various first. This looks like a perfect candidate.

Bah. Good suggestion; I should have thought of it. I was optimistic, but no luck; no match. Thanks for the idea though.  
--  
Dave Ward Photography  
 [http://www.DaveWard.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20130508055912/http:/www.daveward.net/ "http://www.DaveWard.net")

Sorry Dave for the bad advice... hopefully I can make it up to you with this.

I think [Good Times Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20130508055912/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/good-times/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D118%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DEINORST%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D26) might just be your huckleberry.

[Sui Generis](http://web.archive.org/web/20130508055912/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/sui-generis/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D118%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DEINORST%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%26seed%3D30) by Typodermic is right in the wheel house as well but not exact.
